intro: Lastrea glandulifera, commonly known as the glandular lastrea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, showcasing adaptations to conserve water. Its unique morphology and ability to bloom in harsh conditions make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
